stepTitle: A ball is thrown upward from a height of $$1.5$$ $$m$$ at an initial speed of $$40$$ $$\frac{m}{sec}$$. Acceleration resulting from gravity is $$-9.8$$ $$\frac{m}{{sec}^2}$$. Neglecting air resistance, solve for the velocity v(t) and the height h(t) of the ball $$t$$ seconds after it is thrown and before it returns to the ground.
